comments.body: This is probably not needed. I don't think you're using any 3.5 specific features.

Thank you for the review.

Omit was introduced since 3.5.
https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-5.html

That being said, we can define Omit by ourselves.
```
type Omit<T, K> = Pick<T, Exclude<keyof T, K>>;
```

Either is fine with me.  If you think keeping the version is beneficial, I'll follow the advice.

I completely missed the `Omit`. In that case 3.5 makes sense. I think bumping up the version it's the best approach. Make note that some users might decide to lock to a specific version of the `d.ts` until they move to a newer ts version.
